locations.title: U1: Temple of Darkness
locations.description:
Faction War [Adventure], p. 78.

NPC: Incarus, Vanuire, Ghargaross.

No powers are revered there, far below the Hive Ward: the name simply conveys its aura of fear and evil. A yagnoloth named Incarus serves as the “high priest” of the Temple. His servants include two nycaloth lieutenants (Vaniure and Ghargaross) and a large force of mezzoloth, piscoloth and canoloth underlings.

The Nightmare Shaft at the center of the temple allows the yugoloth to seep into the dreams of others.

locations.title: L6: Ubiquitous Wayfarer Inn
locations.about:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 57
Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 137
Pre Faction War
locations.description:
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 57.
Dead Gods [Adventure], p. 137.

NPC: Raien Blackhome, Mirta, Hulester.

Located in the Lower Ward, this tavern has entrances across the City (especially in the Clerk’s Ward) due to a variety of portals that lead to its location. It houses a large number of portals that lead across the planes.

  • Pre Faction War

locations.title: L10: Black Sail Tavern & Inn
locations.about:
The Eternal Boundary [Adventure], p. 16
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47
locations.description:
The Eternal Boundary [Adventure], p. 16.
In the Cage: A Guide to Sigil, p. 48.
Dungeon Magazine #55, pp. 18-47.

NPC: Zaren, Salja, Horrn, Inimigle, Turia.

A quiet tavern frequented by craftsmen who work near the Armory and the border to The Lady’s Ward. Built from the remnants of an ancient galleon, though none know how it ended up in Sigil.
